thread.title: LG Dissolves Delhi Govt’S Advisory Body: LG Dissolves Delhi Govt’s Advisory Body, Wants ‘Domain Experts’ in Place | India News - Times of India
thread.title_full: LG Dissolves Delhi Govt’S Advisory Body: LG Dissolves Delhi Govt’s Advisory Body, Wants ‘Domain Experts’ in Place | India News - Times of India

author: TNN
title: LG Dissolves Delhi Govt’S Advisory Body: LG Dissolves Delhi Govt’s Advisory Body, Wants ‘Domain Experts’ in Place | India News - Times of India
text: NEW DELHI: Lieutenant governor V K Saxena has approved temporary dissolution of Dialogue and Development Commission of Delhi (DDCD) and removal of its non-official members till a mechanism for screening and selection of domain experts as its vice-chairman and members is developed.Making an observation on a file, which was moved by the services department of Delhi govt, LG said the entire exercise of creating DDCD by AAP govt was intended to extend financial benefits and patronage to “certain favoured political persons” of partisan inclinations.The LG has also asked the finance department to humanely explore the possibility of recovering the salaries paid to the non-official members of DDCD.We also published the following articles recently Delhi LG VK Saxena asks AAP govt to sort out issue in amicable mannerSaxena criticizes AAP for politicizing water shortage, inefficient water treatment, and legal disputes. He urges for dialogue, goodwill, and maintenance of water networks for efficient crisis resolution.111197596 LG VK Saxena accuses AAP of using Delhi water crisis to gain political mileageVK Saxena criticized AAP for politicizing the water crisis. Atishi's hunger strike pressured Haryana for water supply. BJP protested water issues, questioning AAP's motives. Poonawalla cited Supreme Court on water supply, challenging AAP's stance on the water tanker mafia.111191494 Jackky Bhagnani's production house Pooja Entertainment accused of non- payment of salaries, crew member pens long notePooja Entertainment, a production company behind popular films like Bade Miyan Chote Miyan and Jawaani Jaaneman, faced backlash for delaying crew salaries. The accusations shed light on financial issues and unprofessional conduct within the film industry.111182271
